Together we can make marijuana legal in New Jersey.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

We’ve come so far in our fight to legalize marijuana in a way that advances racial and social justice — but we need to ramp up the pressure. We’re having a Facebook Live event on Tuesday, May 14 at 7 p.m. about our progress and how you can help.

We’ll also share actions you can take and upcoming advocacy we want you to be a part of. RSVP now to the Facebook Live event.

FACEBOOK LIVE EVENT:
HOW WE GET TO LEGALIZATION

Tuesday, May 14, 7 p.m.
Join us online

RSVP TODAY

If passed, the legalization bill S2703/A4497, would advance racial and social justice by:

  • Expunging marijuana convictions for possession and low-level distribution and dismissing pending charges.
  • Prohibiting discrimination against people based on past marijuana convictions.
  • Creating opportunities for communities of color, women, disabled veterans, and other marginalized groups to fully participate in the cannabis industry.
  • Reinvesting tax revenue in local communities and in state initiatives including cannabis regulation, expungement, job-training, and other important priorities.

We need you there with us, for the Facebook Live and for the rest of the fight ahead. Only through legalization can we begin to address the tragic harms of the failed drug war. RSVP today!

We wouldn’t have come this far without your support — we need your help to get the bill to a vote.

Thank you for all that you do,

Sarah Fajardo
Policy Director, ACLU of New Jersey
